dt: {bc}the person, thing, or idea that is present or near in place, time, or thought or that has just been mentioned
{bc}what is stated in the following phrase, clause, or discourse

dt.t: I can only say {wi}this{/wi}: it wasn't here yesterday

dt: {bc}the one nearer or more immediately under observation or discussion

dt.t: {wi}this{/wi} is iron and that is tin

et: Middle English, pronoun & adjective, from Old English {it}thes{/it} (masculine), {it}this{/it} (neuter); akin to Old High German {it}dese{/it} this, Old English {it}thæt{/it} that
shortdef: the person, thing, or idea that is present or near in place, time, or thought or that has just been mentioned
what is stated in the following phrase, clause, or discourse

dt: {bc}being the person, thing, or idea that is present or near in place, time, or thought or that has just been mentioned
{bc}constituting the immediately following part of the present discourse
used especially in narrative to give a sense of immediacy or vividness
{bc}being the nearer at hand or more immediately under observation or discussion

shortdef: being the person, thing, or idea that is present or near in place, time, or thought or that has just been mentioned
constituting the immediately following part of the present discourse
constituting the immediate past or future

dt.t: It seems that everyone has a cell phone {it}these days{/it}.
What kind of music are you listening to {it}these days{/it}?
{it}These days{/it}, she has a very busy social life.
A lot has happened inside {it}these four walls{/it}.
{it}One of these days{/it}, I'm going to buy myself a boat.

shortdef: at some time in the future
